thing-type.label: HA-ZW-5SE Door/Window Sensor
thing-type.description: Door/Window Sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<ul&gt<li&gtThe AIBASE Door/Window Sensor contains a sensor body and a magnet.</li&gt <li&gtThe AIBASE Door/Window Sensor detects through the separation and combination of the main body and the magnet.</li&gt <li&gtRecommend installation distance between the sensor body and the magnet is 10mm.</li&gt <li&gtThe Sensor also anti‐tamper functionality. Once the sensor is moved, it will notify the gateway.</li&gt <li&gtThe AIBASE Door/Window Sensor is powered by CR2 battery with 2 years battery life.</li&gt <li&gtThe AIBASE Door/Window Sensor is designed to be mounted on the door or windows.</li&gt <li&gtThe AIBASE Door/Window Sensor supports low battery alarm function.</li&gt <li&gtThe AIBASE Door/Window Sensor supports firmware OTA.</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtAdd for inclusion: </p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtInsert the battery.</li&gt <li&gtSet the Z-Wave network main controller into learning mode.</li&gt <li&gtShort press the action button one time.</li&gt <li&gtIf the add for inclusion is successful, the LED will blink fast and then keep on 3 seconds. Otherwise, the LED will blink 25 seconds and then turn off, in which case you need to repeat the process from step </li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtRemove for exclusion;</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtInsert the CR battery.</li&gt <li&gtSet the Z-Wave network main controller into exclusion mode.</li&gt <li&gtShort press the action button one time.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtIf the remove for exclusion is successful, the LED will blink fast and turn off. Otherwise, the LED will keep solid for 2 seconds and then turn off, in which case you need to repeat the process from step 2.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtShort press 3 time.</li&gt <li&gtLED will blink one time; sending wake up notification cc</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Level of low battery
parameter.description: This parameter defines a battery level as the “low battery”<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable settings: 0‐50 (0% ‐ 50%) </p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 10 (10%)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Enable/Disable BASIC SET command
parameter.description: Door/Window Sensor can send BASIC SET command to nodes associated with group 2.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – Disable.<br /&gt1 – Enable.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Value of the BASIC SET
parameter.description: Reverse value of BASIC SET when the magnet is triggered.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 –Send BASIC SET VALUE = 255 to nodes associated with group 2 when door/window is opened. Send BASIC SET VALUE = 0 to nodes associated with group 2 when door/window is closed.</p&gt <p&gt1 –Send BASIC SET VALUE = 0 to nodes associated with group 2 when door/window is opened. Send BASIC SET VALUE = 255 to nodes associated with group 2 when door/window is closed.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Send BASIC SET VALUE = 255 when Opened
Send BASIC SET VALUE = 255 when Closed

parameter.name: config_254_1
parameter.label: 254: Enable/disable the configuration command
parameter.description: Lock/unlock all configuration parameters.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – Unlock.<br /&gt1 – Lock.<br /&gtDefault setting: 0</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Group 1
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt <ol&gt<li&gtNotification Report.<br /&gtSensor will send Notification Report when the supported event is triggered.</li&gt <li&gtBattery Report.<br /&gtSensor will send Battery Report when the battery level is low and the battery report’s value is 0xFF.</li&gt <li&gtDevice Reset Locally.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Group 2
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt <p&gtBasic Set, Sensor will send Basic Set when the sensor body and magnet removed or combined.</p&gt
